origin: Middle English from Old French, from Latin possessio(n-), from the verb possidere (see possess).

definitions.definition: The state of having, owning, or controlling something.
definitions.example: she had taken possession of the sofa

definitions.definition: Something that is owned or possessed.
definitions.example: I had no money or possessions

definitions.definition: The state of being controlled by a demon or spirit.
definitions.example: they said prayers to protect the people inside the hall from demonic possession
